fields.summary: Cannot sort by custom field in the list navigator when in "find issues"

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1) Search for all issues by a given criteria, for example, search for all "resolved" issues, such that Jira returns some results.  Let's say 10 results are returned.
2) Select one of the returned issues to view, say issue 10.  The page you are taken to, in the top right corner says "Issue 10 of 10"
3) Edit the issue such that it no longer meets your search criteria.  For example, change its status to "closed"
4) In the top right corner, the navigator still says "Issue 10 of 10".  It probably shouldn't say that, because this issue no longer meets the search criteria, though I'm not sure what it should say.
5) Click "Return to search"
6) The search results no longer include the issue you edited.
7) Select another issue to view, say issue 9.
8) The page you are taken to says "Issue 9 of 10".  It should say "Issue 9 of 9", since there are now only 9 results that match the criteria.
fields.summary: Y in "Issue X of Y" not updated underneath "Return to search" navigator when issue changes so that it doesn't meet criteria

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6985].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

We are assessing how we can simplify and improve the filter sharing model. This suggestion is important for the JIRA development team, but we have not scheduled work and cannot provide an estimate.

I understand this may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently the filter-sharing is something we use a lot. And it works really well.
However, the problem with sharing the filters is that only one person can modify them - and that they can only be shared with one group.
Ultimately, the filters are owned by a user.

What would be nice is if you could save filters at the Project Level - and anyone who is a project administrator can Manage them.
They would be public by nature - ie if you can browse the project, you can see the filters.
I guess they would also be for that project only...
fields.summary: Project-level Filters
Add service to get all custom fields for a project and issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6982].
  {panel}

This would be just like getSavedFilters, except it returns the default filters:

 - All
- Outstanding
- Unscheduled
- Assigned to me
- Reported by me
	- Resolved recently
- Added recently
- Updated recently
- Most important

This would be quite useful!  I would really like this feature.

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a class that implements com.atlassian.configurable.ValuesGenerator in order to generate values that are used in the configuration of a portlet.

I used the method com.atlassian.jira.issue.CustomFieldManager.getCustomFieldObjects(java.lang.Long projectId) for getting the list of ALL the custom fields associated to a project with id projectId.

I see three alternatives right now in the API docs:

List getCustomFieldObjects(org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue issue)
List getCustomFieldObjects(Long projectId, List issueTypes)
List getCustomFieldObjects(Long projectId, String issueType)

Which one could I use? I mean, I don't know which are the expected objects to be passed as parameters (apart from projectId...), because the javadocs don't provide any further information about their meaning...


TIA

And to make everything consistent, add tips to links in the other sections too...

fields.description:
I noticed JavaScript errors on the issue page when using the german locale. The FireFox JavaScript Console shows the problem:

    initPinComments('Immer anzeigen',
                    'Immer 'Kommentar hinzufügen' Bereich anzeigen',
                    'Zunächst ausblenden',
                    ''Kommentar hinzufügen' Bereich zunächst ausblenden');


The same code from jira.atlassian.com looks like this:

    initPinComments('Always show',
                    'Always show add comment area',
                    'Initially hide',
                    'Initially hide comment area');

The problem is obviously some unencoded quotes. I could probably fix this by modifying the language properties, however it is a general problem: the contents of the language properties files must be properly encoded in any location.
fields.summary: JavaScript problem

fields.description:
Hello,

I have defined a custom field whose type is Date Time. I needed a Date Time that I would update ONLY automatically, so I copied the original velocity templates from JIRA and just rewrited the edit-datetime.vm file to change the html input field shown with a simple readonly message that displays the value of the field. This is the definition:

<customfield-type key="com.ya.cqa.jira.plugin.customfield.readonlydatetime" name="Date Time (Auto)" class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateTimeCFType">
        <description>Extensión del Custom Field "Date Time" que no es editable dado que se actualizará automáticamente</description>
        <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="templates/readonlydatetime/view-datetime.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="edit" location="templates/readonlydatetime/edit-datetime.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="xml" location="templates/readonlydatetime/xml-date.vm"/>
 </customfield-type>

Well. It works. The next step was to define a searcher. I defined the following one:

    <customfield-searcher key="com.ya.cqa.jira.plugin.customfield.readonlydatetime.searcher" name="Date Time (Auto) search template"
        class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.DateTimeRangeSearcher">
        <description>Extensión de la plantilla de búsquedas necesaria para poder buscar en campos de tipo Date Time (Auto)</description>
        <resource type="velocity" name="search" location="templates/readonlydatetime/search/search-daterange.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="templates/readonlydatetime/search/view-searcher-daterange.vm"/>
        <valid-customfield-type package="com.ya.cqa.jira.plugin.customfield.Dates" key="com.ya.cqa.jira.plugin.customfield.readonlydatetime"/>
    </customfield-searcher> 

BUT it turns out that com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.DateTimeRangeSearcher is not in jira.war ??? I saw it in the JIRA API docs, but its class is not available, so JIRA complains at boot time. What searcher should I use instead? I have tried it with the com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.DateRangeSearcher class, and the corresponding "before" and "after" search text fields appear at the left lower corner of the "Find issues" section, but it never finds any issue when I select a date in the calendar popup (and, by the way, given that my custom field type is DateTimeCFType, I think it should be used with a DateTimeRangeSearcher... at least it sounds as its corresponding searcher...)

I'm storing dates in that custom field (a post function workflow plugin does it automatically...), that I would like to be able to search and need to plug in this automatically-updated-but-readonly-for-users-date-time-custom-field asap, but don't want to do it until I know I won't have to redefine it because of this problem...


TIA
fields.summary: Need to create a customfield-searcher for a Date Time custom field but documented JIRA DateTimeRangeSearcher.class is not in the .war !!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6922].
  {panel}

When tracking issues from multiple third-parties, it would be very helpful if JIRA could track which third-party each user belonged to. With this information there is a lot that could be done:
 - provide security so that third-party users have more privileges on issues from their own company
 - extend the search interface so that users can simply search all of their own issues
 - similarly these users can now create useful filters such as 'my company's open issue'

Ideally this company/third-party information would be collected in a secure way so that it can be relied upon.
 - require the user provide an email from the company's domain, and then verify it
 - require an administrative user from each company so that they can add and remove users

I realize that some of this could be done as custom fields and workflows, but it would make sense to me for this to be a core part of the product. For example, on jira.atlassian.com, I'd love to be able to write filters such as "my company's unresolved issues". I also would really like to be able to edit issues created by my co-workers, and to remove ex-employees or reassign their issues to someone else.
fields.summary: Add support for tracking third parties

fields.description:
It appears to be typical that when a user links two issues together they put in a comment like:

  "This is a duplicate of JRA-999"

What they don't realize is that this comment gets attached to both the original issue where it makes sense, and to the target issue (JRA-999) where it makes no sense at all. Now there is a circular link on JRA-999 with no indication of where the other issue came from.

The workarounds that we use for this are:
1. Never attach comments when linking, but then add a separate comment afterwards.
2. Be very careful to word the comment so it makes sense on both ends (e.g. "JRA-1111 is a duplicate of JRA-999")

These are tolerable, but it requires that everyone carefully read the documentation.

I think the web interface could be improved to make this clearer. Some possibilities:
 - put some wording to make it clear that this comment will be attached to both issues.
 - allow the user to write two comments, one for each issue (maybe defaulting one from the other)
 - only attach the comment to the source issue
 - put some extra text into the target comment. e.g. "Linked from JRA-1111: this is a duplicate of JRA-999"
fields.summary: Reduce confusion in comments attached to linked issues

fields.description:
It is complicated right now to resolve an issue as a duplicate, even though this is one of the most common maintenance tasks. It would be very helpful if this use case could be simplified.

So what I'm imagining is that when using the "Resolve Issue" page to mark an issue as a duplicate, the "Link Issue" component would be available right there. It might make sense for all resolution types, or it could be that it is hidden until the user selects 'Duplicate'.

I realize that duplicates aren't a built-in link type, but they are so common that I imagine every development group has them. Maybe this has to be an option in case there are some teams that don't want this.
fields.summary: Make it easier to resolve duplicates

fields.description:
With 100 users in 4 timezones, most of our access is through the corporate portal; Sun One Portal.  This is a proxying server that modifies incoming HTML.  Version 2.6.1 was working fine except for date popups, but with our change to 3.1.1, the portal has completely mangled the Jira user interface because globals.css is missing.

The problem is in the way the portal server rewites things.  It doesn't understand your new <style> tag:

We have patched our instance of Jira 3.1.1 (see attached), but hope you don't make all your style sheet references work this way.  

More details;
This works:
<link type="text/css" rel="StyleSheet" href="<%= request.getContextPath() %>/styles/global.css" />
  it gets rewritten.  Here's what you see when you "view source" from your browser:
  <link type="text/css" rel="StyleSheet" href="https://someexternalportal.com/http://test.someinternalserver.com/jira/styles/global.css"/>
  
This doesn't work:
<style type="text/css" media="screen">@import "<%= request.getContextPath() %>/styles/global.css";</style>
  it doesn't get rewritten at all.  This is what you see when you do "view source" from your browser:
  <link type="text/css" rel="StyleSheet" href="/jira/styles/global.css" />
fields.summary: refernce to global.css doesn't work with proxy server

fields.description:
In upgrading from 3.1.1 (by exporting and importing) my estimates have been erroneously shortened. For example, a task which had an estimate of "4 days" in 3.1.1 now has an estimate of "1 day 8 hours" in 3.2.

I believe this stems from the fact that in Jira 3.1.1 I have set weeks to be 5 days, and days to be 8 hours. It looks like the import has ignored that fact and used 24 hour days to convert 115200 seconds to 32 hours and then to "1 day 8 hours", rather than converting it to "4 days".

If I check "Administration .. Time Tracking", my 3.2 installation is correctly set to 8 hour days.

One other thing that may be relevant is that I am exporting from a Jira 3.1.1 that is using SQL Server, and importing into a Jira 3.2 that is using hsqldb.

I've raised this as a "Blocker" as it is preventing us upgrading to 3.2, but I'll understand if the Atlassian folks downgrade it somewhat. Especially if they can provide me with a workaround.
fields.summary: Upgrade from 3.1.1 to 3.2 breaks time estimates

JIRA should say that the filter has been modified and display a Save option, at the moment it doesn't.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator does not detect changed filter

fields.description:
Assignee field is unordered

On the create & edit screens the Assignee field is not sorted. I guess this should be sorted by BestName
fields.summary: Assignee field is unordered

fields.description:
I ran a search ("Reported Issues" modifed to allow for any issue status), and sorted it by priority in descending order. I viewed the first and then the second issue, and decided to change the order by sorting on key. So I clicked on Return to Search, and then clicked on the Key column to sort by Key ascending. Then I clicked on the first issue and while it did take me to that issue, it told me it was issue 25 of 42 (based on its place in my original search rather than the new one). 
I can't recall exactly what steps I did next (sorry), but I was trying to figure out what I had done, and then I got an error which I've attached.
fields.summary: Issue navigator doesn't respect/remember new search order

fields.description: When switching to the French locale all pages seem to translate to French (way cool), except for the page that launches when you click on the "Filters" popup. I couldn't find an open issue for this.
fields.summary: no translation for (French) filters popup

fields.description:
I would be interested in a method for creating SubTask Issues.  Attempting to use createIssue fails saying invalid issue type.  Sub-Tasks need to have 'parent' issue.  A method could be just like createIssue except you would have to specify a parent issue key to setup a hierarchy.  Something like this would be useful

 createSubTask( token, Parent_issueKey, newSubTask )

(which could return a remoteIssue like createIssue does)  It would have to check that the Parent_issueKey is not a sub-Task already (I don't think sub-sub-tasks is allowed).  This method would be a useful feature.
fields.summary: Add ability to create sub-task via soap

fields.description:
After upgrading to 3.2 we can no longer attach screenshots to issues.

We get the following error:

Did you forget to sign the applet?

I get the same error trying to attach at screenshot at jira.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Applet missing certificate

fields.description:
Opening an screenshot is shown in same browser windows. Users find this confusing, the close the browserwindow and also Jira.
Showing the screenshots in a different (popup)window would be nicer.
fields.summary: Show attachment/screenshot in own (popup)window

fields.description: When deleting a field configuration an IllegalStateException is thrown
fields.summary: IllegalStateException when deleting Field Configuration

fields.description:
Raised on behalf of Wendell Beckwith

I just updated to Jira 3.2 and the create issue screen no longer stretches as wide as my browser window.  Instead I now have roughly 60% of the right side of the browser window empty.  Most elements are the right size, however the summary, environment and description text fields and ares would be alot wider.  It seems like css being done wrong.
fields.summary: Create issue screen no longer stretches as wide as my browser window
Display a warning when removing a user from the 'jira-users' group

fields.description: A user reports that whenever the click 'Configure' in the issue navigator to configure the columns, they are 'logged out' (actually, prompted to enter their username/password).  The same thing happens when clicking 'Profile' in the top-right.
fields.summary: 'Logged out' when accessing user profile, configuring issue navigator columns

fields.description:
I'm comparing the output of building 3.2 from source to what is in the 'installed' version, and there are lots of diffs.  Many of them seem innocuous (e.g. whitespace), but there are several code differences.

What's up with that?
fields.summary: Building from the source produces different output than what's in the released version

fields.description: There is some HTML in the description of one of our issues.  On the Edit Issue page, the rest of the page doesn't get rendered properly as the HTML in the description value of the issue isn't escaped properly.   This makes it so I cannot edit this particular issue.
fields.summary: Description TEXTAREA on Edit Issue page doesn't escape HTML properly

fields.description:
I have 6 security levels

There are groups that have access to some security levels and there are other groups that can access ALL security levels.

How can the users identify the security level of an issue if they have access to multiple security levels ?
fields.summary: Assistance required in finding issues based on security level

fields.summary: Cannot add new portlet

fields.description: After editing a filter in Jira, then clicking on the "View" button, a link giving the user the option to save the current filter displays.  It would be helpful to also have a "Save As" link here also, which would give the user the option to save the changed filter settings under a different name. I have found this feature very helpful. See attached screen capture.
fields.summary: Edit Filter: Need "Save As" option

fields.description: When configuring an existing portlet, the number of issues defaults to 5, not to the current number of issues that had already been configured for the portlet.
fields.summary: Edit Portlet: Show Saved Filter - incorrect default for Number of Issues

fields.description:
We want to prevent anonymous access (read, write, everything) to our Jira system.  There does not seem to be a way to exclude user "anonymous" from group "anybody" (should probably be a separate new feature request?), so the alternative is to create a group with all current users in it.

The Group menu does not allow adding of users (via a user selector), so the only alternative seems to be to senect each user and move him into the group- VERY tedious with a large number of users.

How is this best solved?
fields.summary: Need to add all users to a group

fields.description:
Hi,


I've been able to get the a reference to a CustomField object with a code like this:

CustomField cfDateField = ManagerFactory.getCustomFieldManager().getCustomFieldObjectByName("nameOfTheCustomField");


And to get the value of the CustomField for a given issue (an instance of GenericValue), like this:

Object object = cfDateField.getValue(issue);


But now I'd need to change that value (concretely within a workflow plugin fuction...). How could I do that? I don't see any kind of setValueXXX() applicable method...


TIA
fields.summary: How to change the value of a custom field within a plugin

fields.description:
I've tweaked our JBOSS 4.0.1 according to CONF-1635 to run JIRA and CONFLUENCE on a single JBOSS instance. The new Versions of  JIRA and CONFLUENCE include  commons-logging-1.0.4 which causes trouble with the class loading settings i made(seems to be a common problem with  JBOSS). 
I replaced  the lib with commons-logging-1.1Dev  and it works.  Is it ok to use commons-logging-1.1Dev or are there any sideeffects to be expected?

Cheers,

Philip
fields.summary: Problems with commons-logging-1.0.4 on JBOSS

fields.description:
Currently for displaying parts of the issue table, many database queries are made.  The following fields need database calls:
- parent issue (summary field)
- sub-tasks
- components
- fix versions
- affected versions

We should create an issue implementation that is based on a document, (which has those fields normalised) for a performance increase.
fields.summary: Create a document base implementation of an issue, and use that in Search Results

fields.description:
Need to enable the dotNetSoapEncFix flag for SOAP RPC service. This will hopefully allow the .Net users to have fewer problems with our SOAP service.

This also needs us to upgrade to Axis 1.2 final, which is a good thing!

Should keep an eye out for:
http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS-1976

fields.description:
I've just tried upgrading to JIRA 3.2, and am getting an error whenever I try to perform a search.

I've tracked down the problem, it's occouring with custom numeric fields using a floating point value, line 33 of LongFieldStatisticsMapper is attempting to cast the string to a long value, when it should be casting it to a double value.

Maybe it should be renamed NumericFieldStatisticsMapper and return a BigDecimal value rather than a long?




Here's a stack trace:

2005-06-02 10:15:01,299 ERROR [StandardWrapper[/jira:action]] Servlet.service() for servlet action threw exception
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "12.4"
    at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
    at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:412)
    at java.lang.Long.<init>(Long.java:671)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.LongFieldStatisticsMapper.getValueFromLuceneField(LongFieldStatisticsMapper.java:33)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator$1.getComparable(LuceneQueryCreator.java:241)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.util.JiraLuceneFieldCache.getCustom(JiraLuceneFieldCache.java:42)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.util.MappedSortComparator.getComparatorUsingTerms(MappedSortComparator.java:32)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.util.MappedSortComparator.newComparator(MappedSortComparator.java:26)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.FieldSortedHitQueue.getCachedComparator(FieldSortedHitQueue.java:183)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.FieldSortedHitQueue.<init>(FieldSortedHitQueue.java:58)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:122)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.getMoreDocs(Hits.java:64)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.<init>(Hits.java:51)
    at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.search(Searcher.java:49)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.runSearch(LuceneSearchProvider.java:116)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHits(LuceneSearchProvider.java:60)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getSearchResults(IssueNavigator.java:536)
    at org.apache.jsp.includes.navigator.table_jsp._jspService(org.apache.jsp.includes.navigator.table_jsp:162)
    at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:99)

fields.description:
The 'Assignee Only Condition' fails if assignee is changed on transition screen.

This is due to the fact that the issue is retrieved from the database initially and then cached. This cached issue is subsequently used throughout the conidtion and results in errors when validating - workaround is to retrieve issue from database each time for validation purposes.
